section.heading: Medical treatment authorized.
section.text: When the Agency has physical custody of a child pursuant to § 4-1303.03 or pursuant to § 16-2313 or § 16-2320, it may:

para.text: Authorize a medical evaluation or emergency medical, surgical, or dental treatment, or authorize an outpatient psychiatric evaluation or emergency outpatient psychiatric treatment, at any time; and
Authorize non-emergency outpatient medical, surgical, dental or psychiatric treatment, or autopsy, when reasonable efforts to consult the parent have been made but a parent cannot be consulted.

annoGroup.heading: History
annoGroup.annotation: Sept. 23, 1977, D.C. Law 2-22, title III, § 305, 24 DCR 3341

annoGroup.heading: Effect of Amendments
annoGroup.annotation: D.C. Law 13-277, in the lead-in sentence, substituted “Agency has physical custody of a child pursuant to § 4-1303.03” for “Department of Human Services has physical custody of a child pursuant to subsection (b) or (c) of § 4-1303.04”; rewrote par. (1); and, in par. (2), inserted “outpatient”. Prior to amendment, par. (1) read:
“(1) Authorize a medical and psychiatric evaluation and/or emergency medical, surgical, dental, or psychiatric treatment at any time; and”

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.annotation: For applicability of D.C. Law 13-277, see note following § 4-1303.01a.
